Message.Title: GE GE BOARD
Message.Msg: Yesterday, in response to a post about Yahoo's liberal political views, I suggested reading the GE board that had hundreds really obnoxious comments about the President and others. Rather than deal with the GE board, Yahoo simply deleted my comment! Message to the Yahoo employees responsible for these message boards: Deleting criticism of your policies doesn't change anything. By purposely allowing the underlying problems to continue, you are, individually and collectively, part of the reason why Yahoo and its stock price continues to deteriorate. Think about it.

Message.Title: Sounds and actually looks to me Like Dan Loeb will be bailing soon (or is already in the process)
Message.Msg: And when you look at the chart the last days it looks like Loeb is liquidating his position in YHOO between 14.9 and 15. From his letter to investors - have a close look that he excludes the investment community from the mentioned "happy" stakeholders as well as wishing her the best (usually being done when parting with someone): "Mayer is a leading innovator in Silicon Valley whose creative vision made her a critical part of Google’s leadership team. Her appointment was received favorably by employees and the tech community. We were very pleased to have had the opportunity to work with our fellow directors towards this extremely positive outcome and wish Marissa the best."

Message.Title: Be Careful
Message.Msg: The coming news may be bad - Dan Loeb exiting Yahoo! and YHOO as well as an upcoming loss pre-announcement. Just my two cents. But after following this very closely over the last years and months, I'm sure Dan Loeb doesn't share the new direction of Yahoo with excessive spendings. One just has to have a look at his YHOO presentation from last September (September 14th, 2011) to see that it doesn't fit any more

Message.Title: When was the last time YHOO made any kind of sustained up move??? Hard to...
Message.Msg: remember. After Bartz was fired it did move from the absurdly low $11 to around $16 on the hope they were finally going to sell the company, (but Yang and his pal Ma sabotaged that). Also it moved up to $18.84 May 2011 before Yang fell asleep (on purpose?) at AG BOD meetings and allowed Ma to steal Alipay. But YHOO is just stuck in the mud and that is why it needs to be sold to another company that can remove the toxic from YHOO.

Message.Title: Facebook should dump Yahoo
Message.Msg: Yahoo has been slowly sneaking in connections with Facebook, and it seems like the closer they tie the knot, the more Facebook stock prices fall. Given Yahoo's history, the best move for Facebook might be to cut those ties and RUN - far away and fast...

Message.Title: The slooooow walk to 13
Message.Msg: So slow u won't even realize it

Message.Title: EBAY/ AMZN/ PCLN / GOOG vs FB / YHOO
Message.Msg: MARISSA can you generate revenue with your gidgets? YHOO and FB boast about 700M to 1 Billion users- SO WHAT is what wall street says to these 2 companies. EBAY / AMZN / PCLN / GOOG they have business models that actually convert users into revenue and profits. When a company like FB and YHOO stop focusing on DOING BUSINESS with users, Wall Street will shun it and put it into the garbage bin- look at FB and YHOO. Zuckerburg always insinuated, FB is not about making $$ - it is about bringing people together. He sold 30M share at IPO close to $40/share. Thiel and Accel Partners are out 60M + shares last week. Does Marissa understand DOING BUSINESS with Yahoo Users? Does Marissa understand Yahoo 700 M POTENTIAL CUSTOMERS wants and needs? It is NOT ABOUT THE FANCY GIDGETS....( looking at Loeb ) What Were U Thinking?????

Message.Title: Marissa needs to buy earnings and revenue GENERATORS
Message.Msg: Which is what Yahoo lack. Yahoo stock will only MOVE UP, IIFFFF Marissa how wall street thinks and wants. Wall street only rewards companies that make money (25% net margin) and grow 20% + year over year. Groupon is a good FIXER UPPER. (many Yahoo users already DO BUSINESS w GROUPON). Yelp does not make $$. BUT may be it can be fixed up into making $$ (most FB +YHOO users also use YELP). It has to make 20% growing revenue y-o-y, and become profitable asap.

Message.Title: YHOO shareholders have a right to be angry at the lack of tranparency and progress. Look at....
Message.Msg: ...the up moves this year for AOL, MSFT, GOOG, AAPL etc. and yet YHOO goes nowhere but down. And they hire a young, inexperienced (#20 employee at GOOG which might mean she is good or was just lucky to hitch her wagon to the GOOG rocket-she did date one of the founders and GOOG had to hire a women at that point just for diversity) pregnant CEO who has only watched the stock drop and whose big idea was to emulate GOOG's free food. And where is she??? Those who have held YHOO for a while should be very impatient and not favor a drawn out restructure (i.e. a gamble, and yet another one, all fits and starts) but get some big decisive moves, (i.e. sell the company). Does MM even understand the frustration or is she only looking to her five year plan and baby????

Message.Title: According to article Mayer was recently demoted at GOOG and pushed out of the inner circle. No wonder she...
Message.Msg: ...jumped at the YHOO job but one has to wonder if, like Scott Thompson, she actively solicited it. How can YHOO make such bad hires when they had Levinsohn already there, experienced, well liked, and making decisive moves in his short tenure. And all they really needed for him to do was negotiate a sale of the company, or its parts (and do a large buy back of shares). Now no one knows what is happening at YHOO except that the share price has fallen in a strong market, there is free food, and Marissa is having a baby.

Message.Title: Does the term "a kid in a candy store" come to mind vis a vis Marissa?

Could be with our toxic YHOO BOD and management that thinks free food and i-phones are a great move. But just a couple of actual good moves (or one real buyout-and they should be looking for one) could easily move it above $20. The value is there but the ability to realize it is not. So far I give Mayer a 2 out of 10. Thompson had a 4 out of 10 and Ross was a 7, with a bullet.
